clinical_study.brief_title: Persistent Pain After Breast Cancer Treatment (PPBCT) - Risk Factors and Pathophysiological Mechanisms
clinical_study.official_title: Persistent Pain After Breast Cancer Treatment (PPBCT) - Risk Factors and Pathophysiological Mechanisms

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a prospective cohort study following breast cancer patients from before surgery to one year after. The aims of the study are to determine risk factors that predispose to the development of persistent pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of the study is 1) to determine pre-, intra and post surgical risk factors for persistent pain after breast cancer treatment 2) to examine the prevalence of persistent pain 6 and 12 months after surgery 3) provide a quantitative sensory testing (QST) profile of the patient population, measured pre surgery, 1 week and 12 months after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk factors predisposing for persistent pain after breast cancer treatment
primary_outcome.description: Pre-, intra- and postoperative risk factors predisposing for persistent pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of persistent pain after breast cancer treatment
Prevalence of sensory disturbances after breast cancer treatment
Correlation of persistent pain after breast cancer treatment and damage of the intercostobrachial nerve
Quantitative sensory testing: profile and correlation to persistent pain, sensory disturbances, signs of neuropathic pain, and treatment related factors
Genetic markers and the development of persistent pain after breast cancer treatment
QST profile 1 week after surgery for breast cancer
secondary_outcome.description: Detailed QST profile 1 week after surgery for breast cancer. Patients will be assessed with sensory mapping, followed by assessment of mechanical and thermal thresholds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute pain after surgery for breast cancer
secondary_outcome.description: Prevalence of acute pain 1 week after surgery for breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Test-Retest of QST after breast cancer treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A test-retest series of a subgroup of patients assessed with QST, to evaluate methodological reliability. Patients are scheduled to 2 QST assessments with a week between.

arm_group.description: Female breast cancer patients without metastasis and locally advanced disease

study_pop.textblock: Breast cancer patients treated in a university hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with breast cancer
- 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to give written consent
- unable to understand Danish
- Previous cosmetic surgery in the breast
- Previous surgery in ipsilateral breast
- Bilateral cancer
- Concomitant corrective surgery on contralateral side
- Pregnant
- Other disease or injury in the nervous system
- Psychiatric disease
- Alcohol or drug abuse
